Intermediate Frond End developer role with one of the established players in the Digital assets space comprising of Cryptos, NFTs and Smart Wallet.
Permanent role in a stable, tightly knit, super flexible team environment handling projects in cutting edge technology like web3, gamification of infrastructure, blockchain etc.

The role:

Intermediate front end development with React & React Native framework.
Being part of the product team working on web3 dashboards and mobile applications along with projects on gamification of infrastructure.
Dealing with senior internal as well as external business stakeholders and translating the same into technical requirements for the development team.
Mentoring junior team members and ensure they adhere to minimum coding standards.
Work closely with other developers, UX designers and business.

The ideal candidate:

You will need to have commercial front-end development with React & React Native (mandatory) along with experience or knowledge in Typescript (preferred).
Good communication skills.
Problem-solving & solutioning attitude.

What’s on offer:

Competitive salary.
Extremely flexible to the extent of being remote. Might have to just come in for few hours during important team meetings.
Knowledge and learning about Crypto and NFT from the best in the business.
Supportive team environment, encourage solutioning approach to a problem irrespective of hierarchy in the organization.
Faster coding to production timeline push.

Pls note: A valid NZ work visa is a pre-requisite for all our positions as of now. In case any client is willing to sponsor an international candidate, we would mention that separately.
Apply today! Should you have any questions, please call DC on 0225005159 or Swati on 0220606355 or email – dchoudhuri@welovesalt.com with your cv.

Salt is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Project: Mobile Mid-Core Games

OPM are working with a New Zealand based Games Developer looking for a Senior Programmer to join a talented team of Developers to work on a range of exciting up and coming titles!

You will be working closely with designers and artists to lead a dev team from prototypes to final world-wide releases of existing and future/new IPs and titles.

The studio promotes a fun, dynamic and diverse culture.

Are you an experienced programmer with demonstrable Unity skills, looking to help drive the success of an independent ambitious studio?

REQUIREMENTS:

Extensive industry experience within the mobile sector having shipped at least 2 titles.
Passionate for producing robust, flexible, and extendable gameplay systems.
Extensive and demonstrable Unity experience.
Experience across multiple systems such as Networking, Graphics, Sound, UI, Animation, Economy etc
Superb verbal communication skills and a drive to get the best from everyone on a team.
Understanding of and an ability to communicate the balance between technical & design choices and a willingness help resolve any conflicts to provide the best player experience.
Some experience of leading a commercial team beneficial.
Have a positive and enthusiastic work attitude and a team player who can integrate well into a fun work culture.

BENEFITS:

Wellness Days
Gym Membership Allowance
Medical Cover

We are looking for a passionate and proven Front-end developer to help us build awesome products in Web 3. Being both a development house and creative studio we place high emphasis on pixel perfect design which carry through to our products.We don’t just think about layout and placement, we think about how we can engage the user with small adjustments like animations and movement.The role will be a mix of planning, developing, maintenance, support and team collaboration on our products. You will be working in a close-knit high performing team, so strong communication skills and confidence with a fast-past environment are essential.
Responsibilities
Working closely with senior stakeholders to understand business requirements and help translate these into technical requirements for the development team.
Designing, building, and configuring applications to meet business process and application requirements.
Directing the development team in the design, development, coding, testing and debugging of applications.
Writing testable, scalable and efficient code and leading code reviews.
Mentoring junior team members and ensuring they adhere to determined software quality standards.
Planning and documenting technical specifications for features or system design.
Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
Build pixel-perfect, smooth UIs across both mobile platforms.
Implement new features and products as required.
Work closely with other developers, UX designers, and business as required.
Requirements
Great communication and planning skills
Strong knowledge of React and React-native framework
Experience with Typescript
Mobile development experience
Experience with identifying and addressing performance issues
Experience designing and implementing business logic
Experience with receiving content from APIs
Blockchain knowledge (Nice to have)
Exposure to Web3 (Nice to have) We are looking for a passionate and proven Front-end developer to help us build awesome products in Web 3. Be part of a leading tech business that develops supply chain engines for some of Australasia’s biggest brandsWork on projects where you’re actually trusted and empowered to make meaningful change for some of Australasia’s leading logistics companies?Be part of a team that focuses on getting the job done and having a good time while doing it?We’re Origin, part of the Kiwi-owned and operated software business, Sandfield, and we build super-smart supply chain software solutions that make a big difference to some big brands.We’re working on some pretty ‘meaty’ projects right now and there’s plenty more in our pipeline...so we need more talented Software Developers to join our awesome team.*About us*Our parent company, Sandfield, has built a formidable reputation for developing innovative software solutions for clients, and has been punching well above its weight, since it opened its doors in 1989.As a company, we pride ourselves on NOT being a conventional tech company. In fact, we like to push the boundaries of what’s possible in everything we do.The Origin supply chain team helps clients get a complete view of their supply chain operations to give them a competitive edge.Our software facilitates high performance supply chains for the likes of Mainfreight, Qube and Allied Concrete just to name a few.Your job will be to help us develop bespoke tech solutions that help our clients load, ship, transport and deliver to their customers expectations at the same time as providing better visibility of what’s going on in their supply chain than ever before.Our pitch to youWe know it’s a competitive market out there and loads of other companies are also probably trying to ‘woo’ you right now with big numbers and equally big promises.What we can offer is something a little more special.Our developers get to deal directly with our clients and we spend just as much time nurturing soft skills, such as communication and business acumen, as we do helping our developers be even more ‘ninja’ at their coding.We guarantee your ‘everyday’ will be interesting, varied, challenging and fun! You’ll get to work alongside a range of other smart developers of all levels, who also happen to be really great people too.They’re mountain bikers, road bikers, skiers, runners, active relaxers, video gamers, animal lovers, movie buffs, gym buffs, foodies, wine critics, bakers and musicians. They’re also family people, single people, party people, quiet people, loud people and happy people.Our collaborative culture is at the centre of everything we do and it makes it a pretty special place to work. We know this because people also don’t tend to leave - i.e. the average length of service here is at least five years.We also have a beer fridge, funky offices and ‘fun food Fridays’!But don’t just take our word for it - here’s what our people say about working at Sandfield (video link).As an organisation, we’re also very conscious of our environmental footprint and are currently on a journey to become carbon neutral in the very near future.Our tech stackWe work across a variety of technologies, although specialise in a Microsoft stack, and always select the right technology based on our client’s. We’re primarily building web-based applications but have opportunities for mobile development as well.We love to work across the full stack - but we know that is a lot to learn so don’t worry if you don’t have full stack experience, we have plenty of experienced devs to learn from and support you as you go.You’ll need:Experience building web application using.NET - WebAPI, MVC or WebFormsHTML, CSS and JavaScript.Microsoft SQL ServerRemember - even if you don’t have experience across the full stack we’d still love to have a chat to youBonus points for experience with React or React NativeAn interest in all aspects of the SDLC including talking to clientsWhen you work for us, you’ll enjoy: Rapid career advancement based on initiative and performanceA huge variety of workA relaxed, supportive and social environmentAn opportunity to work alongside some highly experienced developersThe freedom to employ creative thinking and really make a difference to our clients’ businessesBeing involved in everything from conceptual design to the full SDLCA flat team structure that emanates lots of positive energy!Flexible working policySoft skills trainingRegular social events and ‘Fun Food Fridays’A well stocked beer fridge (including non-alcoholic!) and fruit bowl1Password for Families free of chargeFree flu shotsMake your next move with us!If you’re happy with just being a number at a big brand tech company so your Mum can brag at Bridge Club...we’re probably not for you.But if you want to join a great team and be part of the driving force behind some innovative supply chain solutions for some top companies in this part of the world, then let’s talk!Even if you’re comfortable in your current role, but want to explore future opportunities, it could still be worthwhile having a chat with us.You can check out more about Sandfield and what it’s like working for us hereJob Type: Full-time Be part of a leading tech business that develops supply chain engines for some of opened its doors in 1989.As a company, we pride ourselves on NOT being a conventional tech company. In fact, we like to push the boundaries of what’s possible in everything we do.The Origin supply chain team helps clients get a complete view of their supply chain operations to give them a competitive edge.Our software facilitates high performance supply chains for the likes of Mainfreight, Qube and Allied Concrete just to name a few.Your job will be to help us develop bespoke tech solutions that help our clients load, ship, transport and deliver to their customers expectations at the same time as providing better visibility of what’s going on in their supply chain than ever before.Our pitch to youWe know it’s a competitive market out there and loads of other companies are also probably trying to ‘woo’ you right now with big numbers and equally big promises.What we can offer is something a little more special.Our developers get to deal directly with our clients and we spend just as much time nurturing soft skills, such as communication and business acumen, as we do helping our developers be even more ‘ninja’ at their coding.We guarantee your ‘everyday’ will be interesting, varied, challenging and fun! You’ll get to work alongside a range of other smart developers of all levels, who also happen to be really great people too.They’re mountain bikers, road bikers, skiers, runners, active relaxers, video gamers, animal lovers, movie buffs, gym buffs, foodies, wine critics, bakers and musicians. They’re also family people, single people, party people, quiet people, loud people and happy people.Our collaborative culture is at the centre of everything we do and it makes it a pretty special place to work. We know this because people also don’t tend to leave - i.e. the average length of service here is at least five years.We also have a beer fridge, funky offices and ‘fun food Fridays’!But don’t just take our word for it - here’s what our people say about working at Sandfield (video link).As an organisation, we’re also very conscious of our environmental footprint and are currently on a journey to become carbon neutral in the very near future.Our tech stackWe work across a variety of technologies, although specialise in a Microsoft stack, and always select the right technology based on our client’s. We’re primarily building web-based applications but have opportunities for mobile development as well.We love to work across the full stack - but we know that is a lot to learn so don’t worry if you don’t have full stack experience, we have plenty of experienced devs to learn from and support you as you go.You’ll need:Experience building web application using.NET - WebAPI, MVC or WebFormsHTML, CSS and JavaScript.Microsoft SQL ServerRemember - even if you don’t have experience across the full stack we’d still love to have a chat to youBonus points for experience with React or React NativeAn interest in all aspects of the SDLC including talking to clientsWhen you work for us, you’ll enjoy: Rapid career advancement based on initiative and performanceA huge variety of workA relaxed, supportive and social environmentAn opportunity to work alongside some highly experienced developersThe freedom to employ creative thinking and really make a difference to our clients’ businessesBeing involved in everything from conceptual design to the full SDLCA flat team structure that emanates lots of positive energy!Flexible working policySoft skills trainingRegular social events and ‘Fun Food Fridays’A well stocked beer fridge (including non-alcoholic!) and fruit bowl1Password for Families free of chargeFree flu shotsMake your next move with us!If you’re happy with just being a number at a big brand tech company so your Mum can brag at Bridge Club...we’re probably not for you.But if you want to join a great team and be part of the driving force behind some innovative supply chain solutions for some top companies in this part of the world, then let’s talk!Even if you’re comfortable in your current role, but want to explore future opportunities, it could still be worthwhile having a chat with us.You can check out more about Sandfield and what it’s like working for us hereJob Type: Full-time Show more

Gladeye is looking for an experienced Senior Developer with strong values and an extraordinary technical skill set.
You’ll be an essential part of a multidisciplinary team of digital product and experience designers making beautiful, original work. As a Senior Developer, you’ll help define the technical vision for products and projects, and work collaboratively towards real-world execution and impact.
We’re a team based in Auckland, working with clients throughout the world. We're open to remote candidates for this role, and a range of work experiences and world views.
What You’ll Do
Solve complex problems with elegant code solutions.
Shepherd projects from planning phases to well-crafted, easily maintained deployments that brilliantly meet requirements.
Create rapid concept prototypes, utilising established and new technologies.
Work closely with project teams and designers, contributing creative technical solutions and clearly communicating what’s possible.
Contribute and maintain best practices for development.
Mentor junior team members and represent Gladeye in industry forums.
Requirements
5+ years of front and back-end experience with websites or digital products.
Fluency in HTML/CSS/JavaScript, with and without frameworks.
Experience in a front-end framework such as React or Vue.
Experience in PHP, Git, and a containerisation system such as Docker.
The ability to integrate with third-party platforms, APIs and dynamic content.
Communication skills to clearly describe technical ideas.
The ability to learn quickly and the passion to keep up with constantly changing technologies.
A strong understanding of responsive interfaces, contexts, screens and devices.
A desire to do work that makes the world better.
An optimistic, inclusive attitude that makes everyone feel safe, calm and creative.
Benefits
36-hour work week.
Flexible remote work options, up to $1,000 contribution to home office setup and mobile plan (NZ).
A culture that prioritises happiness and growth, including $2,000/year towards your professional development.
Purposeful work designed to make global impact.
Carbon offsets for all the work and transport you do with us.

When you join Verizon
Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.
What you’ll be doing...
At BlueJeans by Verizon, we’re transforming the way people meet by creating a human connection in every experience. Together, we’re bringing immersive meeting experiences to everyone, regardless of location or device, including mobile, desktop, or room systems. We work with thousands of companies worldwide to upgrade everyday meetings, large-scale events, and social network broadcasts by replacing traditional web conferencing with face-to-face video communication. All our customers have one trait in common: they understand the benefits to bringing their employees, leaders, and partners closer together.
BlueJeans engineering team focuses on achieving an ideal balance between customer delight, innovation and developer experience. We have a great mix of backgrounds and expertise across a deep stack of technologies and a culture of collaborative problem solving. We’re at a great size for smart, motivated individuals to come in and challenge themselves to grow to the next phase of their careers. We are looking for a skilled iOS Developerto be part of a lean agile team developing apps and features that will change how the world works together. Along with the rest of your team, you will be responsible for delivering great experiences on iOS.
Collaborating with your peers to produce quality, scalable code primarily in Swift, with some Objective-C.
Adopting development best practices through clean architecture, documentation and code reviews.
Working with other teams like Product Management and Design to clarify and refine requirements.
Understanding requirements, estimating, planning and developing new features.
Debugging and fixing bugs found, including communication with customer support and related teams.
Participating in sprint planning, daily stand up, retrospectives and code reviews.
Mentoring juniors on good coding practice, development processes and collaboration.
Having fun and contribute both technologically and culturally to a great work environment.
Where you'll be working...
This hybrid role will have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days as set by the manager.
What we’re looking for...
If you are somebody who is passionate about the Apple ecosystem, loves pushing the boundaries of both software and the development environment, then we want to work with you.
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience within the Apple ecosystem.
Experience in Swift or Objective-C.
Knowledge of the entire iOS development ecosystem including usage of frameworks like UIKit, accessibility, XCTest and analysis tools, Xcode debugging tricks, App Store submission process, analytics toolchains, etc.
Even better if you have:
A degree.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience in macOS development.
Experience and interest in technologies outside the iOS development environment such as server-side or web development.
Experience with video/signaling technologies (e.g. H.264, HLS, SIP, OpenCV).
Experience in automated testing an iOS app using either built-in frameworks (XCTest, UIAutomation) or third-party tools (Appium, KIF, AWS Device Farm, etc.).
Possess an interest in design and desire to provide customers a great user experience.
Diversity & Inclusion
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
Please note, in countries where there is a COVID-19 related government order or rule, Verizon is required to ensure that all employees accessing our workplace comply with these mandatory requirements. If you work in one of these locations, you will be required to provide us with your vaccination status prior to joining. If this, or any other COVID related requirement applies in your location, we will notify you about this before you start work. When you join Verizon

Are you passionate about AWS and excited about engineering NZ’s most complex Cloud Platforms?Do you have a passion for working with people and solving problems?
Do you thrive working in a dynamic environment with a team of talented people who take pride in delivering great results?

About the team
The future of technology is becoming more mobile, distributed and connected, creating exciting challenges for solution developers to match the pace of new technology. Serverless platforms are one of those emerging technologies, setting a new standard in place of traditional architecture and delivering continuous drives business innovation and changing the way we view technology.
To support the emergence of cloud platforms, Deloitte’s Platform and Cloud Engineering team (PACE) is focused on engineering large scale Cloud platforms to support innovation, helping our clients to disrupt their industry, connect their business to customers, and make better decisions about themselves.

As a result, we are looking to add senior Engineering talent to our AWS Site Reliability Team based in Wellington. You’ll work with the rest of the team and advise our customers on solutions, and implement them using scripting and automation such as Cloud Formation or Terraform.
What will your typical day look like?
Use your knowledge of AWS services to advise and engineer effective cloud solutions.
Efficient reaction time to gather requirements and maintain a high level of customer service based on agreed service level agreements (SLA’s) to work across a variety of clients.
Active involvement in the design, build and deployment infrastructure solutions.
Provide a high level of attention to system monitoring, patching and maintaining an optimized cloud platform for Managed Services customers.
Conduct technology proof of concepts and developing innovative solutions based on client needs.
Ability to think critically and solve business use cases to provide fit for purpose solutions.
Strong desire to learn new tools, processes and methodology across a variety of tools and technologies.
A self-starter with an ability to work independently and commitment to problem solving.
An active contribution to share and grow knowledge base in any technology discipline across wider Deloitte Consulting colleagues and external community groups. You are encouraged to upskill and gain certifications.
Maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders and vendors.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you! You are someone with:
A passion for Engineering who wants to join a team that values and rewards it.
A background in Site Reliability Engineering or Cloud managed services, ideally with an IT vendor, consulting or professional services organisation.
Experience supporting AWS platforms preferred but also open to Azure, Open Stack or Google Cloud backgrounds. Certifications would be highly advantageous.
A high level of competency across virtualization, storage and networking.
Experience in either Linux (Amazon, RedHat, SUSE) OR Microsoft Windows (2008, 2012, 2016) Server environments.
Good exposure to Web Services, API, Rest or RPC protocols.
A sound understanding of DevOps, ITIL, ITSM, IT security and monitoring frameworks.
High level of understanding of disaster recovery, high availability, fail over and redundancy processes.
Ability to demonstrate a sound understanding of modern software development/scripting techniques such as Java.NET, PHP, Perl, Ruby and Python.
Excellent communication skills with high attention to detail. Fluent English language (written and verbal) skills are a must. Any other language skills will be a bonus.
Next Steps
If you have the drive and passion to succeed, apply now.
From 11 April 2022 it is no longer a condition of our COVID Response policy that our people, clients, contractors and visitors be vaccinated to attend our premises, Deloitte events or client premises (except where a client has a vaccine pass mandate in place). However, given the changing nature of the pandemic, we do reserve the right, following a Health & Safety Risk Assessment, to require that a role be performed by a person vaccinated against COVID-19 to minimise the health and safety risk to our people therefore ongoing collection of vaccination status will be important for managing future risks.
Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.
We understand there have been cases of phishing emails purporting to be recruiters for Deloitte. Any communication from Deloitte New Zealand regarding an employment application will come from a “@deloitte.co.nz” or from our Applicant Tracking System “@hire.lever.co” email address or our video interview platform deloittenz.hirevue.com. If you have received a suspicious email and would like to verify validity of any communications that appear to be from Deloitte New Zealand, please contact us on NZinfo@deloitte.co.nz Are you passionate about AWS and excited about engineering NZ’s most complex Cloud Platforms?Do you have a passion for working with people and solving problems?

An active contribution to share and grow knowledge base in any technology discipline across wider Deloitte Consulting colleagues and external community groups. You are encouraged to upskill and gain certifications.
Maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders and vendors.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you! You are someone with:
A passion for Engineering who wants to join a team that values and rewards it.
A background in Site Reliability Engineering or Cloud managed services, ideally with an IT vendor, consulting or professional services organisation.
Experience supporting AWS platforms preferred but also open to Azure, Open Stack or Google Cloud backgrounds. Certifications would be highly advantageous.
A high level of competency across virtualization, storage and networking.
Experience in either Linux (Amazon, RedHat, SUSE) OR Microsoft Windows (2008, 2012, 2016) Server environments.
Good exposure to Web Services, API, Rest or RPC protocols.
A sound understanding of DevOps, ITIL, ITSM, IT security and monitoring frameworks.
High level of understanding of disaster recovery, high availability, fail over and redundancy processes.
Ability to demonstrate a sound understanding of modern software development/scripting techniques such as Java.NET, PHP, Perl, Ruby and Python.
Excellent communication skills with high attention to detail. Fluent English language (written and verbal) skills are a must. Any other language skills will be a bonus.
Next Steps
If you have the drive and passion to succeed, apply now.

About the team
The future of technology is becoming more mobile, distributed and connected, creating exciting challenges for solution developers to match the pace of new technology. Serverless platforms are one of those emerging technologies, setting a new standard in place of traditional architecture and delivering continuous drives business innovation and changing the way we view technology.
To support the emergence of cloud platforms, Deloitte’s Platform and Cloud Engineering team (PACE) is focused on engineering large scale Cloud platforms to support innovation, helping our clients to disrupt their industry, connect their business to customers, and make better decisions about themselves.

As a result, we are looking to add senior Engineering talent to our AWS Site Reliability Team based in Wellington. You’ll work with the rest of the team and advise our customers on solutions, and implement them using scripting and automation such as Cloud Formation or Terraform.

Do you want to work on projects where you’re actually trusted and empowered to make meaningful change for some of Australasia’s leading companies?Dream of working in a place you can call home rather than have to change your career every two years to get ahead?Want to be part of a team that focuses on getting the job done and having a good time while doing it?If you answered yes to any of the above...then we should talk!We’re Sandfield and we build smart software solutions for some of Australasia’s top brands.We’re working on some pretty cool projects right now and there’s plenty more in our (very long) pipeline...so we need more talented Software Developers to join our awesome team.*About Sandfield*We’re a leading, Kiwi-owned, software business that prides itself on NOT just being a conventional tech company.We've been backing ourselves, and our ability to create great solutions for clients, since we first opened our doors in 1989. Since then, we’ve developed some pretty innovative systems for clients which leave other, more high-profile, software packages in the dust.Our work facilitates high performance supply chains for the likes of Mainfreight, Qube and Allied Concrete and keeps millions of orders and data points flowing for Foodstuffs. It also manages business finances for Toll and Green Acres, helps fill seats on the Interislander for KiwiRail and keeps Les Mills members engaged...plus so much more.One thing we think speaks for itself is that we’ve never had a sales team - our work and success story has been predominantly built on our reputation and referrals alone.*Our pitch to you*We know it’s a competitive market out there and loads of other companies are also probably trying to ‘woo’ you right now with big numbers and equally big promises.What we can offer is something a little more special.Our developers get to deal directly with our clients and we spend just as much time nurturing soft skills, such as communication and business acumen, as we do helping our developers be even more ‘ninja’ at their coding.We guarantee your ‘everyday’ will be interesting, varied, challenging and fun! You’ll get to work with a range of other smart developers of all levels, who also happen to be really great people too.They’re mountain bikers, road bikers, skiers, runners, active relaxers, video gamers, animal lovers, movie buffs, gym buffs, foodies, wine critics, bakers and musicians. They’re also family people, single people, party people, quiet people, loud people and happy people.Our collaborative culture is at the centre of everything we do at Sandfield and it makes it a pretty special place to work. We know this because people also don’t tend to leave - i.e. the average length of service here is at least five years.We also have a beer fridge, funky offices and ‘fun food Fridays’!But don’t just take our word for it - here’s what our people say about working at Sandfield Working at Sandfield.As an organisation, we’re also very conscious of our environmental footprint and are currently on a journey to become carbon neutral in the very near future.*Our tech stack*We work across a variety of technologies, although specialise in a Microsoft stack, and always select the right technology based on our client’s needs. We’re primarily building web-based applications but have opportunities for mobile development as well.We love to work across the full stack - but we know that is a lot to learn so don’t worry if you don’t have full stack experience, we have plenty of experienced devs to learn from and support you as you go.You’ll need:Experience building web application using.NET - WebAPI, MVC or WebFormsHTML, CSS and JavaScript.Microsoft SQL ServerRemember - even if you don’t have experience across the full stack we’d still love to have a chat to youBonus points for experience with React or React NativeAn interest in all aspects of the SDLC including talking to clientsWhen you work for us, you’ll enjoy: Rapid career advancement based on initiative and performanceA huge variety of workA relaxed, supportive and social environmentAn opportunity to work alongside some highly experienced developersThe freedom to employ creative thinking and really make a difference to our clients’ businessesBeing involved in everything from conceptual design to the full SDLCA flat team structure that emanates lots of positive energy!Flexible working policySoft skills trainingRegular social events and ‘Fun Food Fridays’A well stocked beer fridge (including non-alcoholic!) and fruit bowl1Password for Families free of chargeMake your next move with us!If you’re happy with just being a number at a big brand tech company so your Mum can brag at Bridge Club...we’re probably not for you.But if you want to join a great team and be part of the driving force behind some innovative tech solutions for a range of top companies in this part of the world, then let’s talk!Even if you’re comfortable in your current role, but want to explore future opportunities, it could still be worthwhile having a chat with us.You can check out more about Sandfield and what it’s like working for us hereThe salary is dependant on skills and experience. Our Purpose
Here at Datacom, It's the People! We are caring and humble and foster an environment where we can bring our best selves to work. Our people make the difference.
A value we hold strong, it's our fantastic team that’s testament to the continued success of our business.
Your career and continued learning and development, is front and center of conversations in our teams. If you choose a technical career focus, or leadership and supporting people is your thing, we have a pathway that will help you achieve these goals! Not to mention an amazing team of experienced mentors to support you getting there. We have a leadership framework created for people through all stages of their career journeys.
Datacom’s reputation has been shaped by investing in our people, our culture and, ultimately, our clients. We can offer the most exciting customer opportunities, whilst ensuring stability, opportunity, and great benefits!
Through challenging times recently and last year, where we have seen the Nation locked down, we carry on, working remotely, and in more ‘normal’ times we offer the flexibility and benefits of a hybrid working model. We’ve even continued to thrive and grow through these times!
The Role

You’ll find a refreshing variety of work here; we cover all aspects of the system lifecycle, including RFPs, software development, testing, release and deployment, maintenance, support, and issue resolution.
As a Full stack developer, you will be confident developing in Java, HTML, JavaScript and cloud PaaS offerings. You should have knowledge about today’s major platforms (Angular, React, AWS or Azure, through to the zen of DevOps) and know how to code and deliver effectively as a team using agile methodologies. You have a passion about technology and an unrelenting desire to learn and grow, and that's where we can help.

Skills and Requirements • Proven hands-on development experience, no matter if it was in the web, mobile or server-side areas

Extensive enterprise application development experience across the Java / J2EE stack
Highly proficient with Spring frameworks such as Spring MVC and Spring Security
Highly proficient in HTML5, JavaScript or JS frameworks e.g. JQuery, Node.js. ReactJS and AngularJS would be an advantage
Proficient in designing and developing RESTful APIs using WSDL, SOAP, JSON, XML,

XSL, XSD and XSLT

Proficient in using ORMS, with a good knowledge of various RDBMS systems
Proficient in using modern development environment stacks
Experience with AWS or Azure environments an advantage
Experience working in agile environments

At Datacom you'll be recognised and valued for your contributions. We’re growing year on year and can provide stability, opportunity and a collegial, flat-structured environment that’s rare in a company of our size. Rather than taking direction, you will be part of the team that is evolving and growing a business.
The Nitty Gritty We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.

PLEASE NOTE DUE TO NEW ZEALAND'S STRICT BORDER RESTRICTIONS WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO CONSIDER NEW ZEALAND CITIZENS AND RESIDENTS OR ANY ONE CURRENTLY IN NEW ZEALAND FOR THIS ROLE AT PRESENT.

Requirements:
Datacom is committed to the health and safety of its people and the wider community. Based on our site access requirements for this role, and/or potential customer site and customer’s vaccination requirements which are constantly developing, the successful applicant will need to be able produce evidence of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19, or a valid exemption. Datacom will consider whether any accommodations can be made for candidates who are partially vaccinated (with remaining vaccine doses booked), or who are unable to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and hold a valid exemption. Combine your expertise in visual design, UX, and research with your strengths in product strategy and design discovery to create innovative and engaging design solutions.
Make a meaningful contribution in your job whilst still maintaining a good balance between work and life.
Be involved in exciting creative and future focussed projects that make a positive difference to the lives of New Zealanders

We’re on the hunt for a creative and innovative Senior Experience Designer to bring their broad range of design expertise to our growing Auckland team. We want someone curious and collaborative, who’s comfortable investigating and understanding complex scenarios and turning them into seamless user experiences that create lasting impact.

In this role, you will be helping to form high level ideas and design strategies, then translate them into unique design directions, and developing digital solutions that are not only visually beautiful, human and emotive but also inventive, daring and brave. You’ll bring with you a well rounded toolkit of discovery, research, collaboration and product design methods and workshop activities and know when to pull them out and use them - and you’ll be adaptable to learning new ones on the job working alongside our strategy and design leads.

You’ll be able to balance technical and organisational constraints and objectives, with diverse user needs, while applying design patterns, brand guidelines and design thinking across multiple projects. You’ll do this while working collaboratively with developers and testers to implement and adapt responsive, accessible designs. You’ll be helping to shape work for your more junior design colleagues, and taking the lead in design conversations with clients, so we’re after someone comfortable in taking the reins when needed and helping to keep the design work on track.

You’ll be an advocate for the principles of ‘good design’, illustration and functionality and know how to unravel complexity in order to produce customer experiences that are desirable and easy to use. You’ll support this with sound, evidence-based rationale and validate the assumptions through research that you’re comfortable preparing for and running . We’re continously iterating and improving our ideas and designs as we go.

If you’re ready to help shape the digital future, we’d love to hear from you.

What it’s like at Alphero
Our values are at the heart of who we are, what we do, and why we are here. Our values shape our vision and support our culture, guide our behaviours, and are woven into every part of the business.
You will work in a fun, friendly, collaborative environment where diversity and individuality are celebrated. Take a seat at the Alphero kitchen table and get to know the team. We don’t sweat the small stuff - everyone works with the latest gadgets, tools and technologies. Tell us what you need to make your work easier.
Our clients - and their customers - come from every sector and all walks of life, and so do we. We hire talented, passionate people, and together we create strong teams that enable us to reach exceptional outcomes. You’ll help keep the team aligned with your ability to tell a compelling story.
At Alphero, we support our people to take their careers to the next level with a built-in growth framework that includes mentoring, training, R&D opportunities as well as learning and discovery through our Ideas Factory Innovation Programme.
Requirements
Four to eight years experience doing UX or UI design for complex enterprise applications, large scale websites and/or complex mobile apps.
A pro across multiple industry standard design software and tools.
Strong understanding of the design patterns required for iOS, Android and mobile/responsive web delivery.
Ability to understand, utilise and remould complex data.
Experience running workshops with, presenting to, consulting and persuading clients at a Senior level.
Ability to design for user needs by utilising research, strategy and analytics.
Experience coaching and mentoring younger team members.

Not sure if you tick off everything on the list? We’d still love to hear from you. Each person brings unique skills and experiences to us. If you have some gaps, we can help with mentoring, upskilling, and cross-skilling.
If possible, please include a link to your portfolio or a small sample of your work in your CV or cover letter so we can view a sample of your work.
Benefits
A supportive, collaborative and creative work environment
Genuine work-life balance including flexible or part-time working hours to suit your lifestyle and the ability to work remotely when you need to.
Three months paid parental leave (full pay) to the primary caregiver / parent, and extended parental leave
Two weeks paid parental leave to the secondary caregiver / parent.
New company phone and mobile account
Commitment to your personal and professional development and ongoing learning
Work with the latest gadgets, tools and technologies
Whatever widget, doodad, licence or gizmo you need to do your job (within reason!)
Super cool office space in the funky Kingsland.
Day off on your birthday - on us!
Discounted gym membership at Les Mills (nationwide)
Great coffee and free fruit
Fun, social team who like to make coming to work not feel like work Combine your expertise in visual design, UX, and research with your strengths in product strategy and design discovery to create innovative and engaging design solutions.
Make a meaningful contribution in your job whilst still maintaining a good balance between work and life.
Be involved in exciting creative and future focussed projects that make a positive difference to the lives of New Zealanders

We’re on the hunt for a creative and innovative Senior Experience Designer to bring their broad range of design expertise to our growing Auckland team. We want someone curious and collaborative, who’s comfortable investigating and understanding complex scenarios and turning them into seamless user experiences that create lasting impact.

In this role, you will be helping to form high level ideas and design strategies, then translate them into unique design directions, and developing digital solutions that are not only visually beautiful, human and emotive but also inventive, daring and brave. You’ll bring with you a well rounded toolkit of discovery, research, collaboration and product design methods and workshop activities and know when to pull them out and use them - and you’ll be adaptable to learning new ones on the job working alongside our strategy and design leads.

You’ll be able to balance technical and organisational constraints and objectives, with diverse user needs, while applying design patterns, brand guidelines and design thinking across multiple projects. You’ll do this while working collaboratively with developers and testers to implement and adapt responsive, accessible designs. You’ll be helping to shape work for your more junior design colleagues, and taking the lead in design conversations with clients, so we’re after someone comfortable in taking the reins when needed and helping to keep the design work on track.

You’ll be an advocate for the principles of ‘good design’, illustration and functionality and know how to unravel complexity in order to produce customer experiences that are desirable and easy to use. You’ll support this with sound, evidence-based rationale and validate the assumptions through research that you’re comfortable preparing for and running . We’re continously iterating and improving our ideas and designs as we go.

If you’re ready to help shape the digital future, we’d love to hear from you.

What it’s like at Alphero
Our values are at the heart of who we are, what we do, and why we are here. Our values shape our vision and support our culture, guide our behaviours, and are woven into every part of the business.
You will work in a fun, friendly, collaborative environment where diversity and individuality are celebrated. Take a seat at the Alphero kitchen table and get to know the team. We don’t sweat the small stuff - everyone works with the latest gadgets, tools and technologies. Tell us what you need to make your work easier.
Our clients - and their customers - come from every sector and all walks of life, and so do we. We hire talented, passionate people, and together we create strong teams that enable us to reach exceptional outcomes. You’ll help keep the team aligned with your ability to tell a compelling story.
At Alphero, we support our people to take their careers to the next level with a built-in growth framework that includes mentoring, training, R&D opportunities as well as learning and discovery through our Ideas Factory Innovation Programme.
Requirements
Four to eight years experience doing UX or UI design for complex enterprise applications, large scale websites and/or complex mobile apps.
A pro across multiple industry standard design software and tools.
Strong understanding of the design patterns required for iOS, Android and mobile/responsive web delivery.
Ability to understand, utilise and remould complex data.
Experience running workshops with, presenting to, consulting and persuading clients at a Senior level.
Ability to design for user needs by utilising research, strategy and analytics.
Experience coaching and mentoring younger team members.

Not sure if you tick off everything on the list? We’d still love to hear from you. Each person brings unique skills and experiences to us. If you have some gaps, we can help with mentoring, upskilling, and cross-skilling.
If possible, please include a link to your portfolio or a small sample of your work in your CV or cover letter so we can view a sample of your work.
Benefits
A supportive, collaborative and creative work environment
Genuine work-life balance including flexible or part-time working hours to suit your lifestyle and the ability to work remotely when you need to.
Three months paid parental leave (full pay) to the primary caregiver / parent, and extended parental leave
Two weeks paid parental leave to the secondary caregiver / parent.
New company phone and mobile account
Commitment to your personal and professional development and ongoing learning
Work with the latest gadgets, tools and technologies
Whatever widget, doodad, licence or gizmo you need to do your job (within reason!)
Super cool office space in the funky Kingsland.
Day off on your birthday - on us!
Discounted gym membership at Les Mills (nationwide)
Great coffee and free fruit

Senior Programmer

Outerdawn - Auckland, NZ

Outerdawn is seeking an experienced Senior Programmer to join their growing team of developers on some very exciting up and coming games! You will be working closely with Designers and Artists to lead a dev team from prototypes to final world-wide releases of their titles.

Are you an experienced programmer with demonstrable Unity skills? Want to help drive the success of an independent ambitious studio? Have a proven track record in shipping high quality mobile titles?

Located in the North Shore of Auckland, Outerdawn is committed to becoming a premier games studio in the southern hemisphere. They have a growing team of industry veterans and talented newcomers working in a fun, dynamic and diverse studio, developing multiple new IPs and titles and have room to grow.


For this role, you will need...
At least 5 years' industry experience within the mobile sector with 2+ shipped titles
A passion for producing robust, flexible and extendable gameplay systems in tandem with designers and artists
Extensive and demonstrable Unity experience
Practical experience across multiple systems e.g. Networking, Graphics, Sound, UI, Animation, Economy etc.
Excellent verbal communication skills and a drive to get the best from everyone on a team
Understanding of and an ability to communicate the balance between technical & design choices and a willingness to help resolve any conflicts to provide the best player experience
A background leading a commercial team(s) beneficial
A positive and enthusiastic work attitude and a team player who can integrate well into a fun work culture


Just some of the benefits of working with Outerdawn include...
A competitive salary
Wellness Days
Gym Membership Allowance
Medical Cover
The chance to be instrumental in the success of a growing and ambitious studio


Interested? Want to know more?


Get in touch with Dave on +44 (0)1709 834 777 or email dave.m@swift.com now! Senior Programmer

Intermediate .Net developer
Permanent
Hamilton based
Looking for Intermediate .Net developer who are open to work with our clients in Hamilton.
Duties
Developing large-scale web and software solutions that meet and exceed client expectations.
Working with clients to apply industry trends and other improvements to solutions to expand their solutions impact and success.
Working within a high-performance team that has a constant view on self-improvement.
Analysing business requirements and communicating these to key stakeholders.
Maintain and share up to date knowledge of best practice and latest trends, with good understanding of when to champion adoption of new technologies.
Contribute to sales activities and lead the quoting process for development projects.
Coach and mentor junior team members in development techniques and provide quality assurance support.

About you:
You are an experienced .NET developer with a keen interest in working directly with clients to develop and expand both existing and new solutions and are excited to work alongside a broad range of clients, (big and small) and technology solutions. You will have the ability to provide technical leadership, as well as the know-how to build applications, and have extensive working experience deploying solutions with an active user base.

A tertiary qualification in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science).
Minimum 3 years’ experience in .NET development with a minimum of one year architecture experience.
Good written and verbal English with ability to write in a client centric way.
Technically savvy across a variety of systems, software and coding languages (e.g. C#/.NET, HTML, JavaScript/TypeScript, CSS & HTML, web and mobile technologies).
Ability to manage your own work effectively and build enduring client relationships.

Note: Must be eligible to work full-time in New Zealand.
Apply now or get in touch with: Nolan Lyke at nolan.lyke@beyond.co.nz OR call on 021 470 595
Essential: Applicants need to have a right to work in New Zealand with a valid visa and be currently present in the Country.
Ref: 118196

Bring your expertise in visual and interaction design, combined with your UX and product design skills to create innovative and engaging design solutions.
Make a meaningful contribution in your job whilst still maintaining a good balance between work and life.
Be involved in creative and innovative projects that make a positive difference to the lives of New Zealanders
We’re searching for a creative and innovative Senior Experience Designer to bring their design expertise to our Wellington based team. We want someone curious and collaborative, who’s comfortable turning complex scenarios into seamless and beautiful user experiences that create lasting impact.
In this role, you will be translating high level ideas into unique design directions, and developing digital solutions that are not only visually beautiful, human and emotive but also inventive, daring and brave.
You’ll be able to balance technical and organisational constraints and objectives, with diverse user needs, while effortlessly applying design patterns, brand guidelines and design thinking across multiple projects. You’ll do this while working collaboratively with developers and testers to implement and adapt responsive, accessible designs.
You’ll be an advocate for the principles of ‘good design’, illustration and functionality and know how to unravel complexity in order to produce solutions that are desirable and easy to use. You’ll support this with sound, evidence-based rationale and validated assumptions - and be continually iterating and improving designs as you go.
At Alphero, we support our people to take their careers to the next level with a built-in growth framework that includes mentoring, training, R&D opportunities as well as learning and discovery through our Ideas Factory Innovation Programme.
If you’re ready to help shape the digital future, we’d love to hear from you.
What it’s like at Alphero
Our values are at the heart of who we are, what we do, and why we are here. Our values shape our vision and support our culture, guide our behaviours, and are woven into every part of the business.
You will work in a fun, friendly, collaborative environment where diversity and individuality are celebrated. Take a seat at the Alphero kitchen table and get to know the team. We don’t sweat the small stuff - everyone works with the latest gadgets, tools and technologies. Tell us what you need to make your work easier.
Our clients - and their customers - come from every sector and all walks of life, and so do we. We hire talented, passionate people, and together we create strong teams that enable us to reach exceptional outcomes. You’ll help keep the team aligned with your ability to tell a compelling story.
Requirements
Four to eight years experience doing UX or UI design for complex enterprise applications, large scale websites and/or complex mobile apps.
A solid understanding and demonstration of user-centered design principles
An ability to recognise and pursue opportunities to better user outcomes and deliver on client strategy.
A pro across multiple industry standard design software and tools.
Strong understanding of the design patterns required for iOS, Android and mobile/responsive web delivery.
Ability to understand, utilise and re-mould complex data.
Experience running workshops presenting to, consulting with and persuading clients at a senior level.
Ability to design for user needs by utilising research, strategy and analytics.
Experience coaching and mentoring less experienced team members.
Not sure if you tick off everything on the list? We’d still love to hear from you. Each person brings unique skills and experiences to us. If you have some gaps, we can help with mentoring, upskilling, and cross-skilling.
If possible, please include a link to your portfolio or a small sample of your work in your CV or cover letter so we can view some of your work.
Benefits
Competitive salary
A supportive, collaborative and creative work environment
Genuine work-life balance including flexible or part-time working hours to suit your lifestyle and the ability to work remotely when you need to.
Three months paid parental leave (full pay) to the primary caregiver / parent, and extended parental leave
Two weeks paid parental leave to the secondary caregiver / parent.
New company phone and mobile account
Commitment to your personal and professional development and ongoing learning
Work with the latest gadgets, tools and technologies
Whatever widget, doodad, licence or gizmo you need to do your job (within reason!)
Super cool office space in the heart of Wellington - close to Cuba Street, the waterfront, Hannah’s laneway and all the best cafes.
Day off on your birthday - on us!
Discounted gym membership at Les Mills (nationwide)
Great coffee and free fruit

Whatever widget, doodad, licence or gizmo you need to do your job (within reason!)
Super cool office space in the heart of Wellington - close to Cuba Street, the waterfront, Hannah’s laneway and all the best cafes.
Day off on your birthday - on us!
Discounted gym membership at Les Mills (nationwide)
Great coffee and free fruit
Fun, social team who like to make coming to work not feel like work Show more

3-4 month contract only
Financial institution
Wynyard Quarter location, 2 days in the office pw
What you will be doing:

Fancy being a part of cross-functional, autonomous squads that are aligned to a purpose that drives value for customers every day? But wait there's more, you will be empowered to make decisions on how squads deliver these experiences, always operating with the customer's best interest at heart.

As a Senior Software Engineer or Software Specialist, your primary role will be responsible for running and maintaining existing web experiences used by tens of thousands of customers nationwide. No pressure!

You'll also provide technical leadership, mentoring, and coaching to other web developers, contributing to the growth of the overall web development team's capability and competence. This takes skill.

To be successful in this role you will:
Love problem solving and love working with people
Take pride in crafting beautiful, performant & secure web experiences (code behind) that people love to use
Have the ability to lead software delivery in an agile squad as well as contribute to a wider community of in-house developers
Have extensive experience in mentoring team members
Be self-directed, be able to embrace change and have proven ability to work collaboratively in an Agile environment
Core Skills:

Great experience in secure, web development with a focus on C# .NET ASP, MVC, Web API as well as modern React front-end applications.
Functional Programming and or OOP
C#, ASP.NET Forms / MVC
Strong SQL, RDBMS knowledge
Accessibility
React + Typescript
NPM or Yarn
Building and consuming .NET REST API's
Webpack, Babel, SCSS
Secure Development
Unit & E2E Testing
Responsive front-end development (mobile first)
Front end performance design and development
How to apply:

Do not muck about, its a short contract. Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

Please apply using an MS WORD version of your CV, as if we proceed with your application this is the format we’ll require to submit to clients.
Note: We review all CV's manually and you will only be contacted if your skills and experience meet the requirements of any of our clients.

Are you interested in using your experience designing and developing world class applications as a well-rounded full stack .NET & web application designer/developer? Are you keen to demonstrate your expertise to come up with innovative solutions for an ever-expanding variety of customer projects?

Theta’s Digital practice is full of supportive, exceptional developers and leads who can help take your professional journey to the next level. We design, develop, and implement innovative, leading edge solutions for our customers using a range of technologies and platforms. We are looking for a Senior Consultant to be a part of the Digital team where you’ll be engaged in web application development projects, largely around the Microsoft stack. You’ll bring innovative ideas to each solution, where quality counts and your insights matter.
You’ll get to work with a team of brilliant minds and thought leaders with opportunities for continued learning and growth.

We like people who:

Are passionate about software development and creating inventive, quality solutions
Bring lots of great experience to the team, yet are always wanting to learn more
Are keen on the principles of DevOps, and strive for automation wherever possible
You care about producing clean, efficient, secure code
Are enthusiastic practitioners of Agile, particularly Scrum and Kanban
Are self-starters who can work well both independently and as part of a team
Possess a knack for identifying issues and providing smart solutions
Thrive in a culture of sharing, inclusiveness, and learning

What we require:

At least 5 years’ commercial experience with the Microsoft development stack - .NET/.NET Core Framework, C#, MS SQL
Web development experience across HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript – including web frameworks like React and Angular
Web application API development experience, including ASP.NET APIs, Azure Functions/API Management, or similar frameworks
Experience with automation, including CI/CD pipelines, test and build automation
Complete knowledge of Agile practices, with experience working in Scrum and Kanban teams
Experience with cloud computing, specifically Azure
Excellent verbal and written skills
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills

Nice to have:

Mobile development experience, particularly with Flutter
Relevant Microsoft certifications
Experience in non-Microsoft tools and frameworks

About ThetaWe thrive on delivering excellence within a collaborative environment, where working hard and playing hard go hand-in-hand. Our exceptional people use cutting edge technology and innovation to achieve smarter solutions, together. With offices in Auckland, Tauranga, Wellington and Christchurch, we're making our mark across the length and breadth of New Zealand where the opportunities within Theta are endless!
Culture and Benefits
Theta offers a family friendly work environment with flexible work hours where practical; especially relevant for caregivers.
We embrace gender equality and are committed to providing a supportive, diverse and inclusive work environment throughout our workplace.
Theta is committed to giving back to the community and are avid supporters of Cure Kids. We compete in various adventure races and do many other things to raise money for Cure Kids. And we make time for the fun things in life!
We currently provide the following benefits to ensure your professional development and personal wellbeing:

Professional growth and learning opportunities
A competitive salary (commensurate with experience)
Fully subsidised medical insurance for employees
Heavily discounted medical insurance for immediate family of employees
Hybrid working model
Volunteer days
Internal Referral Incentive
Staff Assistance Programme
Annual Flu injections
Sick leave from your first day on board
Remote working options where practical and mutually agreed
Daily fresh fruit basket, coffee machine, wide selection of teas and biscuits in all of our offices.
We are also an accredited employer with INZ and have welcomed people from close to 40 different nations

Your Title: Software Engineer
Job Location: Christchurch, NZ
Our Department: Caterpillar Trimble Control Technologies (CTCT)
Does the idea of helping transform the construction industry using cutting-edge technologies excite you?
What You Will Do
As a Software Engineer in one of our delivery teams, you’ll create dynamic, cross-platform, system features that help heavy equipment owners, operators, and technicians do their jobs more efficiently, more effectively, and better than the competition. You will be accountable for the development of high-quality software that hits the mark for what our customers need, working with a team to improve the development process, and doing it all within a large global development framework that is always evolving.
Along with your team, you will predominantly be working on the development and evolution of our Trimble Earthworks System. On a daily basis this will look like:
Collaborating with team members on the development and test scope, architecture, and other development activities.
Working with application domain experts and other software developers across multiple international sites to deliver identified customer value.
Development and evolution of native mobile app solutions in Android, using Java, and a shared C++ code module.
Demonstrating a set of fundamental software engineering skills that result in predictability in engineering, scheduling, and the quality of products developed.

What you'll bring?
Along with being a team player, with strong work prioritisation skills and a collaborative communication and working style, you will also:
Hold a relevant tertiary qualification in computer science, engineering, mathematics, mechatronics, or equivalent experience
Have experience developing software applications that interface with hardware, sensors, or other devices
Have experience in front-end mobile app design and architecture.
Demonstrate expertise in the development of native Android applications
Demonstrate expertise in C++ or a shared framework architecture on mobile
Have experience working within a full engineering process involving specification, development, automated testing, continuous delivery, and documentation.
About Your Location
Based at Trimble’s main campus in Christchurch, New Zealand, enjoy free parking, an onsite gym, an active social club, and a great team environment where people love working with leading technology solutions.
Please Note: Only applicants who are legally entitled to work in New Zealand will be considered.
About Our CTCT Division
The CTCT division (a joint venture between Trimble and Caterpillar) develops positioning and control products for earthmoving and paving machines in the construction and mining industries, using technologies such as GPS, optical total stations, lasers, and sonics. The products are used in a range of applications where the operator of the machine benefits from having accurate horizontal and vertical guidance.
For more information on currently developed products, see construction.trimble.com/earthworks
Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment
We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.

Are you passionate about technology and product excellence?
Full stack development role with a focus on services and endpoints
Permanent role with a flexible WFH mix

Are you passionate about technology and product excellence?
Full stack development role with a focus on services and endpoints
Permanent role with a flexible WFH mix
Great opportunity for a Software Engineer experienced in API development to join a growing busy company providing intelligent solutions to overseas clients.

What our client can offer:

Our client is a New Zealand company based in Christchurch, with offices and a fast growing customer base in the US. This role will draw upon your extensive API development experience in a Real Time software environment. This company is well established, values its people, commits to training and development and works with a wide range of development tools and technologies. Their team environment is welcoming and diverse and values the skills, backgrounds and contribution that each member brings.

What you will do:
Reporting to the CTO you will be responsible for delivering real time software solutions and for meeting and demonstrating high professional standards across coding testing and documentation. Specifically you will:
Be an integral part of a busy software development team, participating in testing and deployment, and contributing directly to the technical development of mobile, cloud, and embedded software.
Be part of of an ongoing transition to an Agile methodology.
Work with solutions on Azure, and over cellular and disconnected networks.
Share and grow your knowledge, collaborating with other developers.
Ensure a high level of service availability is maintained, and, identify and manage risks and troubleshoot issues, including joining the on-call roster (which has additional benefits).
Strengthen a culture of high performance, openness, and continuous improvement.
Skills and experience we are looking for:
This role is best suited to an experienced Senior Software Engineer or an established Intermediate who is ready to step up. We invite applications from candidates who are inclusive, confident communicators, who take pride in working to high standards and who enjoy mentoring others.

Your technical skills and experience must include:
At least 3 years experience developing APIs, Services and Message Queues
C#, .NET 6, SQL Server , Azure DevOps, Azure Pipelines, Git Version Control
Typescript, Javascript, HTML, CSS
A relevant Tertiary qualification

Are you passionate about technology and product excellence?
Full stack development role with a focus on services and endpoints
Permanent role with a flexible WFH mix
Great opportunity for a Software Engineer experienced in API development to join a growing busy company providing intelligent solutions to overseas clients.

What our client can offer:

Our client is a New Zealand company based in Christchurch, with offices and a fast growing customer base in the US. This role will draw upon your extensive API development experience in a Real Time software environment. This company is well established, values its people, commits to training and development and works with a wide range of development tools and technologies. Their team environment is welcoming and diverse and values the skills, backgrounds and contribution that each member brings.

What you will do:
Reporting to the CTO you will be responsible for delivering real time software solutions and for meeting and demonstrating high professional standards across coding testing and documentation. Specifically you will:
Be an integral part of a busy software development team, participating in testing and deployment, and contributing directly to the technical development of mobile, cloud, and embedded software.
Be part of of an ongoing transition to an Agile methodology.
Work with solutions on Azure, and over cellular and disconnected networks.
Share and grow your knowledge, collaborating with other developers.
Ensure a high level of service availability is maintained, and, identify and manage risks and troubleshoot issues, including joining the on-call roster (which has additional benefits).
Strengthen a culture of high performance, openness, and continuous improvement.
Skills and experience we are looking for:
This role is best suited to an experienced Senior Software Engineer or an established Intermediate who is ready to step up. We invite applications from candidates who are inclusive, confident communicators, who take pride in working to high standards and who enjoy mentoring others.

Your technical skills and experience must include:
At least 3 years experience developing APIs, Services and Message Queues
C#, .NET 6, SQL Server , Azure DevOps, Azure Pipelines, Git Version Control
Typescript, Javascript, HTML, CSS
A relevant Tertiary qualification
Applicants must be in NZ or return within the next 4-6 weeks and must hold full work rights.

Do you want to work on projects where you’re actually trusted and empowered to make meaningful change for some of Australasia’s leading companies?Dream of working in a place you can call home rather than have to change your career every two years to get ahead?Want to be part of a team that focuses on getting the job done and having a good time while doing it?If you answered yes to any of the above...then we should talk!We’re Sandfield and we build smart software solutions for some of Australasia’s top brands.We’re working on some pretty cool projects right now and there’s plenty more in our (very long) pipeline...so we need more talented Software Developers to join our awesome team.*About Sandfield*We’re a leading, Kiwi-owned, software business that prides itself on NOT just being a conventional tech company.We've been backing ourselves, and our ability to create great solutions for clients, since we first opened our doors in 1989. Since then, we’ve developed some pretty innovative systems for clients which leave other, more high-profile, software packages in the dust.Our work facilitates high performance supply chains for the likes of Mainfreight, Qube and Allied Concrete and keeps millions of orders and data points flowing for Foodstuffs. It also manages business finances for Toll and Green Acres, helps fill seats on the Interislander for KiwiRail and keeps Les Mills members engaged...plus so much more.One thing we think speaks for itself is that we’ve never had a sales team - our work and success story has been predominantly built on our reputation and referrals alone.*Our pitch to you*We know it’s a competitive market out there and loads of other companies are also probably trying to ‘woo’ you right now with big numbers and equally big promises.What we can offer is something a little more special.Our developers get to deal directly with our clients and we spend just as much time nurturing soft skills, such as communication and business acumen, as we do helping our developers be even more ‘ninja’ at their coding.We guarantee your ‘everyday’ will be interesting, varied, challenging and fun! You’ll get to work with a range of other smart developers of all levels, who also happen to be really great people too.They’re mountain bikers, road bikers, skiers, runners, active relaxers, video gamers, animal lovers, movie buffs, gym buffs, foodies, wine critics, bakers and musicians. They’re also family people, single people, party people, quiet people, loud people and happy people.Our collaborative culture is at the centre of everything we do at Sandfield and it makes it a pretty special place to work. We know this because people also don’t tend to leave - i.e. the average length of service here is at least five years.We also have a beer fridge, funky offices and ‘fun food Fridays’!But don’t just take our word for it - here’s what our people say about working at Sandfield (Working at Sandfield).As an organisation, we’re also very conscious of our environmental footprint and are currently on a journey to become carbon neutral in the very near future.*Our tech stack*We work across a variety of technologies, although specialise in a Microsoft stack, and always select the right technology based on our client’s needs. We’re primarily building web-based applications but have opportunities for mobile development as well.We love to work across the full stack - but we know that is a lot to learn so don’t worry if you don’t have full stack experience, we have plenty of experienced devs to learn from and support you as you go.You’ll need:Experience building web application using.NET - WebAPI, MVC or WebFormsHTML, CSS and JavaScript.Microsoft SQL ServerRemember - even if you don’t have experience across the full stack we’d still love to have a chat to youBonus points for experience with React or React NativeAn interest in all aspects of the SDLC including talking to clientsWhen you work for us, you’ll enjoy: Rapid career advancement based on initiative and performanceA huge variety of workA relaxed, supportive and social environmentAn opportunity to work alongside some highly experienced developersThe freedom to employ creative thinking and really make a difference to our clients’ businessesBeing involved in everything from conceptual design to the full SDLCA flat team structure that emanates lots of positive energy!Flexible working policySoft skills trainingRegular social events and ‘Fun Food Fridays’A well stocked beer fridge (including non-alcoholic!) and fruit bowl1Password for Families free of chargeFree flu shotsMake your next move with us!If you’re happy with just being a number at a big brand tech company so your Mum can brag at Bridge Club...we’re probably not for you.But if you want to join a great team and be part of the driving force behind some innovative tech solutions for a range of top companies in this part of the world, then let’s talk!Even if you’re comfortable in your current role, but want to explore future opportunities, it could still be worthwhile having a chat with us.You can check out more about Sandfield and what it’s like working for us hereThe salary is depenedant on skills and experience.
